Reviews.Title: “Pop Hotel Mongkok”
Reviews.Author: RozwandiMohamad
Reviews.Content: Very Nice hotel, a bit more spacious than other budget hotels in hongkong. walls abit thin though but services are superb....very fast internet connection....easily accessible from mongkok ladies market. very clean hotel too...

Reviews.Title: “A little place in a big city..”
Reviews.Author: Hoteltraveller3105
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Hong Kong a few days ago. If you never been to Hong Kong you might been wondering where to crash..but it all depends on the reason of your trip. If you are on a shopping spree.. then i highly recommend this hotel because it is near to the 'Ladies Market ' which is a bazaar where you can find things and also a shopping mall just a few blocks away.. other than that.. there are also a few 7eleven nearby. Also the MRT station is situated on the lowest level of the shopping mall (forgot the name). If you want to go to Disneyland than you can take the MRT ride there. As for the room..its small but clean and the service is good. But who needs a big room if you planning to go here and there rite? Have a good trip.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently modern metropolitan hotel”
Reviews.Author: tessatomas
Reviews.Content: Worth every penny. Very clean, chic and modern--- I would even rate this as a 4 star boutique hotel. We stayed 2 nights and we were given fresh towels and new set of toiletries daily. Very convenient since its 2 blocks away from Langham Place and Nathan Road. We loved the toilet/bathroom coz of its modern design. Be wary of the hot/cold adjustment of the shower though. Staff are helpful. OK WiFi. Would highly recommend this hotel and would not hesitate staying here when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget hotel in Mongkok”
Reviews.Author: chessmaniac
Reviews.Content: It was a decent hotel in mongkok, clean, convenient but the room is a little small but I guess it is quite common for Hong kong hotels. I paid HKD$990 for a Deluxe Double room and HKD$90 for an extra bed. Overall it is very worth it.

Reviews.Title: “It's just average”
Reviews.Author: SimplySeek
Reviews.Content: If you're really tight down by your budget, you can consider this hotel. Location - Like the others had mentioned, hotel is located at red light district. Pretty safe for girls i would say (consider that you don't wear skimpy like them), as for guys, may not. Cos on my approached back to the hotel, saw a pimp tried to introduce girls to this man. But then again, they do not bug you even if you don't want. It's near to MTR and Ladies market. If you know where to shop, this hotel may be a great help. However, it's a little inconvenience to go to the airport with many bags. You may consider taking cab from them at a flat rate of 280HK dollars. Rooms - Not sound proof. You can hear others switching on and off the light. In the middle of my sleep. Actually heard moaning from the room beside us at about 2am. That's how bad the sound proof is! Everything you need, they have it there. So far so good. The bed is abit hard and the pillows were too soft for me to have a good night sleep. If you have enough money to stretch, try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but pray for considerate neighbors!”
Reviews.Author: jeanzhao
Reviews.Content: Not complaining about the small room, it's like that in Hong Kong. Not qualms about the red light district. They mind their own business, I don't see them talking to men who walk by either. The strengths: - Awesome location - Only 5 minute walk to Ladies Mkt - Delicious street food all around, just 3 minutes walk from the mall - 5 mins walk to Langham Mall if you're into the branded stuff - Friendly cleaning lady - Relatively new hotel, so you don't get furniture which are falling apart. The weaknesses: - Walls are paper thin, I can hear people switching their lights on and off and using the sink. - Crazy kid (abt 12 years old) running up and down the stairs and shouting in his room, kept me awake all night - Inconsiderate neighbors who did not close their room doors properly or leaving their doors open so that their relatives from next door can walk into their rooms without pressing the door bell....and the door security buzzer was beeping all morning and night, until we call for the staff downstairs to ask these inconsiderate people to shut their doors. I was dead tired from all the walking and only wanted a good sleep. The crazy kid and his family and relatives only moved out on the second last night before I can finally have the one good night sleep on the last day of my 5 days tour.

Reviews.Title: “clean and fresh, good price, new rooms & good location”
Reviews.Author: sunnimoreno
Reviews.Content: quiet and safe neighborhood, 3 blocks from mong kok subway station and bus stop for airport bus, hotel staff typically chinese hospitality (no match for thai hospitality) but very helpful and gladly obliged when we asked for additional comforter and 2 pillows - no extra charge. facilities are new and fresh. bathroom is excellent. will definitely stay in this hotel in my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “what great location??”
Reviews.Author: sparkplugfreak
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the red light district of mongkok what is so good about that? from the nearest exit of the MTR (train) it takes around 5-10 mins to walk to the hotel but you won't feel safe walking especially during late nights as the area is generally like the slums in other countries. On one occasion when I went to the nearest 7-11 to buy stuff, 2 girls approached me and asked if I wanted to have a "good time".. really. The hotel staff are very VERY UNFRIENDLY and don't care about you, they just sit there in the reception area feeling like bosses. As for the value, contrary to what other people say, you could have cheaper hotels where you can check-in in SAFER locations. The rooms are small but are clean and nice because they are new. The hotel itself stands out as this is the only nice and relatively new in the area. Pics of the hotel are deceiving as they only show the rooms and the front of the hotel, and NOT the area around. My advice to you guys, check out other hotels first before trying this one.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and nice! Value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Lenard J C L
Reviews.Content: I stay there for the last night for my trip to HK in september 2011. Overall this hotel is just simple and nice. Definitely value for money!! It's just 10 minutes walk to Mong Kok MTR station. It's quite at night. Not easy to get taxi by your own unless you asked the hotel to arrange to you or you make a booking by yourselves with any taxi. From this hotel to airport is around HKD$230 all in. Love their free wifi services!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Enought Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bensy
Reviews.Content: Because of various conventions, many hotels in Tsim sha Tsui and Causeway Bay areas have increase their rates (Sep 2011). Some hotels even charged more than double their usual rates. Thus I looked for other hotels which did not increase their price. And I found Pop Hotel. The hotel provides simple but comfortable room, with free internet, (cable and wifi), daily bottled water, slippers, toothbrush, etc. However, the TV only shows Chinese Channels. While the water supply in the shower is good, the water heater is not consistent. Suddenly the water can turn very cold or very hot. I'm guessing that this is due to small water heater tank. The Hotel is about 10 minutes walk from Langham Place, MTR and shopping District. But it is located in the vicinity of hardware stores selling various metal products, thus I feel that the walk is much longer. The hotel will satisfy many travelers who wants to shop and do not expect a full hotel service. It does not have a restaurant. It is after all a budget hotel. But if you have small children or wants better service, this might not be for you. Restaurant Tip : There is a small Dimsum place popular with the locals, Tim Ho Wan, about 15 minutes walk from the hotel. The wait time is about 1 to 2 hours. But the food is excellent and the price, very reasonable. It gained michellin 1 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: chinzz11
Reviews.Content: hotel good for those who wants to be near langham/ mongkok mtr. svc staff at hotel almost non existent , but we did request for help in calling for a cab to airport. fridge in rm not working but we didnt complain but overheard another sgp couple complaining abt theirs. hotel is surrounded by hardware shops n night time u can see the sleazy massage parlors etc but i din see streetwalkers standing around. though i saw a pimp touting for biz. room is good for short stay , no frills n bathroom is pretty spacious n modern with toothbrushes , soaps , towels etc. in the morning , neighbours moving in & out of their rooms can b noisy but bearable. would not return if i can find a better located b better svc hotel. but if $ is a constraint, tis is quite ok .

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: hktinter
Reviews.Content: We stay here for 2 nights, we arrive at the night time, we walk about 5 min from MTR station Mong Kok. The staff is friendly, the hotel is new and clean but the room is small compare to the price. There is a 7 Eleven across the road, and some small local shop beside the hotel. Near a big Shopping mall Longham Place.

Reviews.Title: “Location of hotel the only plus point”
Reviews.Author: Nying-je
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights last week after reading the reviews at Tripadvisor. New and clean hotel in a super good location - 5 minutes to MTR, Lingram Shopping Centre and Nathan Road. Directly across Nathan Road is Ladies Market . . . which is about all I can appreciate about this hotel. Service is non-exsistence, not even a smile from the lady at the counter even though I greeted good morning first every morning. Pillow too flat I asked for an extra pillow, the guys at the counter did not get back to me. Finally on the last day the elderly uncle at the counter directed me to where to get cab to airport in a friendly manner. Was given 2 complimentary bottle of water on the first day only. As mentioned by one reviewer, the wall defnitely made of paper! In the afternoon I was unpacking while 'enjoying' a lively conversation between the housekeepers. At night my Thai tourist neighbours kept me awake in their conversation till 2am in the morning. Although in a red-light district as mentioned by some reviewers, I did not see any 'beautiful gals' standing around, so shopping till wee hours was not an issue for single gals like me. Nearby no choice of food unless you walk to Nathan road. Will be back to Hong Kong soon. Will I return to stay? Just for the price and location, I can find better choices elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, comfortable & value for money.”
Reviews.Author: AinnieJoe
Reviews.Content: I wld recommend that one shld get a print out of the hotel map. Lucky we did or else the 5 mins walk frm the mtr may take longer than expected. The hotel hav no restaurants, coffee house or whatsoever. But they provide free mineral water. Since it's near to langham shopping centre, you can just grab a bite there. there's street hawkers all ard as well. 4 adults stayed in the hotel only suite. It's a big room for hong kong standard. Equip w 2 televisions. Lucky we were small so 3 ladies squeeze in the queen bed & the guy sleep in the comfortable sofa bed. Not that bad afterall. We stayed

Reviews.Title: “The hotel room defers totally from the hotel pics”
Reviews.Author: matsuSingapore
Reviews.Content: Not advisable for children. The surrounding can be quite scary at night time. But those who want some authentic experience - this will be the one as you can see the true HKG morning wet market.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Excellent price/Brand New -Worth a try if size does NOT matter”
Reviews.Author: NayKat
Reviews.Content: To set expectations - I am a local HK-nese who now lives in the USA, usually stay at Langham place if I travel with hubby due to family in the immediate area (mongkok). This time, try Pop Hotel to save some money as I am traveling solo. POP Hotel SIZE - yes is not a big as others but we are only talking about missing the areas are that one place that we lay our luggage down & the bathtub. Hotels in HK don't offer big rooms anyways, and this is definitely bigger than some Business hotels that I have stayed in Japan for solo travellers (and paid less at Pop). Had a room with 1 bed (is like 2 twin put together king), clean, new, has all that one needs - safe, tv, coffee, dresser. everything is very decent, other than I have to stand my luggage up by the wall the entire stay (which is not a problem for me). Location - Great & Safe - get out of the hotel thru the "automatic door" then go to your left, walk straight 2 blocks (1 block is 1 min in HK) down "soy street" then turn left at either Shanghai st (that's the Langham mall down 2 blocks), or keep on soy for another 2 blocks till you see "Nathan Road" then turn left. those are the 2 most convenient MTRs stations with shopping along (i would say 5 min away from hotel). Others mentioned the brothels along, don't worry, no one bothers you on the street - they are just "signs" and no one "stands on the street" like in other countries. I have got back to the hotel as late as 2am, and there are still regular people on the street & mini bus station right outside of the hotel still in service (Mongkok is a busy place, many restaurants open 24 hours and shopping till midnight). Quietness - agree that walls are thin, just hope u don't get the room right next to the elevator -elevator is loud (my room was almost at the end of the hallway so all I heard was door closing from "neighbors" when they take off or in the middle of 1 night, my neighbor coughed in her sleep. so that tells you, the location itself is quiet, no road noise (had the AC on the whole time, windows shut, curtains closed - no view at all anyways). I had no trouble falling asleep and staying asleep but I can imagine light sleepers might suffer (but they usually wear ear plugs anyways =) ) Cleanliness - Clean & Brand New Hotel, modern decor - no complaints there. Value - paid $570HKD ($74 USD) each night (stayed 3 nights) in advance. Booked thru agent online , submit my request, the they confirmed availability and I paid. Overall - Excellent Value for location & this brand new hotel. Would stay there again ~

Reviews.Title: “New hotel, staff still learning the ropes”
Reviews.Author: adamz75
Reviews.Content: Rooms are tiny but location is good ( as long as you ignore the brothels) close to the markets. Rooms are clean . i would nt suggest this hotel if you are looking for anything more than a stop over or somewhere to sleep and shower. Our room stunk of smoke which was coming through the airvents but they did lend us a de humidifier which helped. Lift was broken during our stay, luckily we were on the first floor (although we requested a hight floor in our booking). No frills but served a purpose.
